events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving rear-end collision at a traffic signal, requesting claim initiation.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under auto accident due to the involvement of the customer’s vehicle in a collision.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned promptly to assist the customer with the vehicle damage claim process.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim filed by the customer.
Customer was requested to submit the police report, vehicle registration, and photos of the damaged car for further evaluation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the accident report, photos, and repair estimates on time.
The insurance investigation team began evaluating the submitted evidence to determine fault and damage extent.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer's vehicle was rear-ended at a stop light with clear fault on the other party.
A settlement offer covering the full cost of repairs and rental car expenses was proposed to the customer.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the handling of their claim.
The claim was formally approved after acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer without any objections.
Final payment for repairs and rental reimbursement was issued to the customer’s bank account promptly.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed following full payment and customer confirmation of resolution.
The claim file was archived in the system for record keeping and future reference if necessary.
